item.title: How California is trying to keep the National Guard away from Trump’s immigration crackdown
item.description:
Attorney General Rob Bonta’s team was the first to challenge Trump on taking over control of the state National Guard under a rarely used law that allows the president to do this in times of invasion, internal rebellion or when U.S. laws cannot be executed with “regular forces” — a contested term.

The post How California is trying to keep the National Guard away from Trump’s immigration crackdown appeared first on Long Beach Post News.
item.source:markdown:
![](https://img.lbpost.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/10/23074128/bonta-newsom-portantino-gun-laws-mg-03-cm-263920-vovt7e4h-799328-COecpkzp-1024x682.webp)
Attorney General Rob Bonta’s team was the first to challenge Trump on taking over control of the state National Guard under a rarely used law that allows the president to do this in times of invasion, internal rebellion or when U.S. laws cannot be executed with “regular forces” — a contested term.
